707859f-a.text:
Second Avenue, northward from E. 39th Street (lower foreground and not seen) as viewed from atop No. 3Ol E. E8th Street. In the foreground is a clearance between F9th and 4Oth Streets and which is shown solely in No. 2. To the north are structures around 42nd Street; the News Building being that on the left. Beyond this is the Crystal Building at the S.W. corner of 43rd Street. To the right are units of Tudor City with its Hotel Woodstock only partially shown. Note the slight widening of tue "E1" tracks
at the 42nd Street station.
September 11, 1931
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Snerr

707859f-b.text:
Second Avenue, northward from E. 39th Street (lower foreground and not seen) as viewed from atop No. 3Ol E. E8th Street. at the 42nd Street station.
September 11, 1931
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Snerr

712525f-a.text:
East 39th Street, north side, east from (No. 331), but not including Second Ave., to the East River. Prominently shown, is one of the pover
houses of the N.Y. Edison Co. Plant.
April 8, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

707862f-b.text:
Second Avenue, at the N. E. corner of East 39th Street, showing the extensive cleared space there. Part of this site is used as a car parking lot. Across same appear units of Tudor City and a generating plant of the Consolidated Edison Company.
June 7, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
